intro: Stenachaenium megapotamicum f. minor, commonly known as the lesser megapotamic stenachaenium, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the Poaceae family. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically thrives in specific, often humid and shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its botanical features include small, clustered inflorescences and a distinctive leaf morphology. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
